bitfield.description: HL 0.8 scheme
Functional Number
RTL revision. [[br]]Will vary depending on release.
Major revision.
Custom revision.
Minor revision
[[br]]00 -> Force Idle (always acknowledges). [[br]]01 -> No Idle Mode (never acknowledges). [[br]]10 -> Smart-Idle Mode. [[br]]11 -> Reserved.
[[br]]Write 0: No action. [[br]]Write 1: Set event (debug). [[br]]Read 0: No event pending. [[br]]Read 1: Event pending.
[[br]]Write 0: No action. [[br]]Write 1: Set event (debug). [[br]]Read 0: No event pending. [[br]]Read 1: Event pending.
[[br]]Write 0: No action. [[br]]Write 1: Set event (debug). [[br]]Read 0: No event pending. [[br]]Read 1: Event pending.
[[br]]Write 0: No action. [[br]]Write 1: Set event (debug). [[br]]Read 0: No event pending. [[br]]Read 1: Event pending.
[[br]]Write 0: No action. [[br]]Write 1: Set event (debug). [[br]]Read 0: No event pending. [[br]]Read 1: Event pending.
[[br]]Write 0: No action. [[br]]Write 1: Set event (debug). [[br]]Read 0: No event pending. [[br]]Read 1: Event pending.
[[br]]Write 0: No action. [[br]]Write 1: Set event (debug). [[br]]Read 0: No event pending. [[br]]Read 1: Event pending.
[[br]]Write 0: No action. [[br]]Write 1: Set event (debug). [[br]]Read 0: No event pending. [[br]]Read 1: Event pending.
[[br]]Write 0: No action. [[br]]Write 1: Set event (debug). [[br]]Read 0: No event pending. [[br]]Read 1: Event pending.
[[br]]Write 0: No action. [[br]]Read 0: No (enabled) event pending. [[br]]Read 1: Event pending. [[br]]Write 1: Clear (raw) event.
[[br]]Write 0: No action. [[br]]Read 0: No (enabled) event pending. [[br]]Read 1: Event pending. [[br]]Write 1: Clear (raw) event.
[[br]]Write 0: No action. [[br]]Read 0: No (enabled) event pending. [[br]]Read 1: Event pending. [[br]]Write 1: Clear (raw) event.
[[br]]Write 0: No action. [[br]]Read 0: No (enabled) event pending. [[br]]Read 1: Event pending. [[br]]Write 1: Clear (raw) event.
[[br]]Write 0: No action. [[br]]Read 0: No (enabled) event pending. [[br]]Read 1: Event pending. [[br]]Write 1: Clear (raw) event.
[[br]]Write 0: No action. [[br]]Read 0: No (enabled) event pending. [[br]]Read 1: Event pending. [[br]]Write 1: Clear (raw) event.

[[br]]Write 0: No action. [[br]]Read 0: No (enabled) event pending. [[br]]Read 1: Event pending. [[br]]Write 1: Clear (raw) event.
[[br]]Write 0: No action. [[br]]Read 0: Interrupt disabled (masked). [[br]]Read 1: Interrupt enabled. [[br]]Write 1: Enable interrupt.
[[br]]Write 0: No action. [[br]]Read 0: Interrupt disabled (masked). [[br]]Read 1: Interrupt enabled. [[br]]Write 1: Enable interrupt.
[[br]]Write 0: No action. [[br]]Read 0: Interrupt disabled (masked). [[br]]Read 1: Interrupt enabled. [[br]]Write 1: Enable interrupt.
[[br]]Write 0: No action. [[br]]Read 0: Interrupt disabled (masked). [[br]]Read 1: Interrupt enabled. [[br]]Write 1: Enable interrupt.
[[br]]Write 0: No action. [[br]]Read 0: Interrupt disabled (masked). [[br]]Read 1: Interrupt enabled. [[br]]Write 1: Enable interrupt.
[[br]]Write 0: No action. [[br]]Read 0: Interrupt disabled (masked). [[br]]Read 1: Interrupt enabled. [[br]]Write 1: Enable interrupt.
[[br]]Write 0: No action. [[br]]Read 0: Interrupt disabled (masked). [[br]]Read 1: Interrupt enabled. [[br]]Write 1: Enable interrupt.
[[br]]Write 0: No action. [[br]]Read 0: Interrupt disabled (masked). [[br]]Read 1: Interrupt enabled. [[br]]Write 1: Enable interrupt.
[[br]]Write 0: No action. [[br]]Read 0: Interrupt disabled (masked). [[br]]Read 1: Interrupt enabled. [[br]]Write 1: Enable interrupt.
[[br]]Write 0: No action. [[br]]Read 0: Interrupt disabled (masked). [[br]]Read 1: Interrupt enabled. [[br]]Write 1: Disable interrupt.
[[br]]Write 0: No action. [[br]]Read 0: Interrupt disabled (masked). [[br]]Read 1: Interrupt enabled. [[br]]Write 1: Disable interrupt.
[[br]]Write 0: No action. [[br]]Read 0: Interrupt disabled (masked). [[br]]Read 1: Interrupt enabled. [[br]]Write 1: Disable interrupt.
[[br]]Write 0: No action. [[br]]Read 0: Interrupt disabled (masked). [[br]]Read 1: Interrupt enabled. [[br]]Write 1: Disable interrupt.
[[br]]Write 0: No action. [[br]]Read 0: Interrupt disabled (masked). [[br]]Read 1: Interrupt enabled. [[br]]Write 1: Disable interrupt.
[[br]]Write 0: No action. [[br]]Read 0: Interrupt disabled (masked). [[br]]Read 1: Interrupt enabled. [[br]]Write 1: Disable interrupt.
[[br]]Write 0: No action. [[br]]Read 0: Interrupt disabled (masked). [[br]]Read 1: Interrupt enabled. [[br]]Write 1: Disable interrupt.
[[br]]Write 0: No action. [[br]]Read 0: Interrupt disabled (masked). [[br]]Read 1: Interrupt enabled. [[br]]Write 1: Disable interrupt.
[[br]]Write 0: No action. [[br]]Read 0: Interrupt disabled (masked). [[br]]Read 1: Interrupt enabled. [[br]]Write 1: Disable interrupt.
Enable DMA request FIFO1. [[br]]Write 0: No action. [[br]]Read 0: DMA line disabled. [[br]]Read 1: DMA line enabled. [[br]]Write 1: Enable DMA line.
Enable DMA request FIFO0. [[br]]Write 0: No action. [[br]]Read 0: DMA line disabled. [[br]]Read 1: DMA line enabled. [[br]]Write 1: Enable DMA line.
Disable DMA request FIFO1. [[br]]Write 0: No action. [[br]]Read 0: DMA line disabled. [[br]]Read 1: DMA line enabled. [[br]]Write 1: Disable DMA line.
Disable DMA request FIFO0. [[br]]Write 0 : No action. [[br]]Read 0 : DMA line disabled. [[br]]Read 1: DMA line enabled. [[br]]Write 1: Disable DMA line.
[[br]]0->Map hardware event to the start of swipe interrupt. [[br]]1->Map hardware event to hardware event input (external).
Analog input will bypass the PreAmplifier: 0: PreAmp is enabled by default. [[br]]1 : Write 1 to bypass PreAmp.
PreAmp Power Down control. [[br]]0: PreAmp is powered up (default). [[br]]1 : Write 1 to power down PreAmp.
ADC Power Down control. [[br]]0: AFE is powered up (default). [[br]]1 : Write 1 to power down AFE.

Enables Simultaneous Control of both AFEs. [[br]]0 -> Control only MCR_AFE. [[br]]1 -> Control both MCR_AFE and TSC_AFE. [[br]]See the Programmers/Usage guide section for Simultaneous Mode Features/Limitations.
Writing 1 to this bit will store the Step ID number with the captured ADC data in the FIFO. [[br]]0: Write zeros. [[br]]1: Store the channel ID tag.

ADC1 module enable bit. [[br]]After programming all the steps and configuration registers, write a 1 to this bit to turn on ADC1. [[br]]Writing a 0 will disable the module (after the current conversion is completed).
Status of OCP FSM and ADC FSM. [[br]]0 idle. [[br]]1 - busy.
Sampled ADC data is compared to this value. [[br]]If the interrupt is enabled, and if the sampled data is > value then interrupt is generated. [[br]]Each step can enable or disable this check.
Sampled ADC data is compared to this value. [[br]]If the interrupt is enabled, and if the sampled data is < value then interrupt is generated. [[br]]Each step can enable or disable this check.
The input ADC clock will be divided by this value and sent to the AFE. [[br]]Program to the value minus 1.
Enable step 16.
Enable step 15.
Enable step 14.
Enable step 13.
Enable step 12.
Enable step 11.
Enable step 10.
Enable step 9.
Enable step 8.
Enable step 7.
Enable step 6.
Enable step 5.
Enable step 4.
Enable step 3.
Enable step 2.
Enable step 1.
[[br]]00: Gain of 12. [[br]]01: Gain of 14. [[br]]10: Gain of 16. [[br]]11: Gain of 18.
Differential Control Pin. [[br]]0 -> Single Ended. [[br]]1 -> Differential Pair Enable.
SEL_RFM pins software configuration. [[br]]00 - VSSA. [[br]]01 - VSSA. [[br]]10 - VSSA. [[br]]11 ADCREFM.
SEL_INP pins software configuration. [[br]]0000 -> Channel 1. [[br]]0111 -> Channel 8. [[br]]1xxx -> ADCREFM.
SEL_INM pins for neg differential. [[br]]0000 -> Channel 1. [[br]]0111 -> Channel 8. [[br]]1xxx -> ADCREFM.
SEL_RFP pins software configuration. [[br]]000 - VDDA. [[br]]001 - VDDA. [[br]]010 - VDDA. [[br]]011 - ADCREFP. [[br]]1xx - Reserved.
[[br]]00: Gain of 12. [[br]]01: Gain of 14. [[br]]10: Gain of 16. [[br]]11: Gain of 18.
[[br]]00: Gain of 12. [[br]]01: Gain of 14. [[br]]10: Gain of 16. [[br]]11: Gain of 18.
[[br]]00: Gain of 12. [[br]]01: Gain of 14. [[br]]10: Gain of 16. [[br]]11: Gain of 18.

Sampled ADC data is compared to this value. [[br]]If the swipe feature is enabled, and if the sampled data is >= value then data is saved in the FIFO (and also subsequent data is saved for all steps). [[br]]

Sampled ADC data is compared to this value. [[br]]If the swipe feature is enabled, and if the sampled data is >= value then data is saved in the FIFO (and also subsequent data is saved for all steps). [[br]]

Sampled ADC data is compared to this value. [[br]]If the swipe feature is enabled, and if the sampled data is >= value then data is saved in the FIFO (and also subsequent data is saved for all steps). [[br]]

Sampled ADC data is compared to this value. [[br]]If the swipe feature is enabled, and if the sampled data is >= value then data is saved in the FIFO (and also subsequent data is saved for all steps). [[br]]

If the Swipe Data Compare feature is enabled (refer to bit 11) then: 00 Trigger using swipe threshold reg1. [[br]]01 Trigger using swipe threshold reg 2. [[br]]10 Trigger using swipe threshold reg 3. [[br]]11 Trigger using swipe threshold reg 4.
[[br]]00: Gain of 12. [[br]]01: Gain of 14. [[br]]10: Gain of 16. [[br]]11: Gain of 18.
[[br]]0 - disable out of range check. [[br]]1 - Compare adc data with range check register.
Sampled data will be stored in FIFO: [[br]]0 -> FIFO 0. [[br]]1 -> FIFO 1.
Differential Control Pin. [[br]]0 -> Single Ended. [[br]]1 -> Differential Pair Enable.
SEL_RFM pins software configuration. [[br]]00 - VSSA. [[br]]01 - VSSA. [[br]]10 - VSSA. [[br]]11 ADCREFM.
SEL_INP pins software configuration. [[br]]0000 -> Channel 1. [[br]]0111 -> Channel 8. [[br]]1xxx -> ADCREFM.
SEL_INM pins for neg differential. [[br]]0000 -> Channel 1. [[br]]0111 -> Channel 8. [[br]]1xxx -> ADCREFM.
SEL_RFP pins software configuration. [[br]]000 - VDDA. [[br]]001 - VDDA. [[br]]010 - VDDA. [[br]]011 - ADCREFP. [[br]]1xx - Reserved.

Set this bit to 1 to enable the swipe data comparing feature: [[br]]0: Feature is off (data is always saved). [[br]]1: Trigger feature is on [[br]] if adc data < swipe data threshold map pointer value then discard data[[br]] otherwise data is saved (and all future steps are saved) until mag_adc enable (bit 0) is turned off.
[[br]]00: Gain of 12. [[br]]01: Gain of 14. [[br]]10: Gain of 16. [[br]]11: Gain of 18.
[[br]]00: Gain of 12. [[br]]01: Gain of 14. [[br]]10: Gain of 16. [[br]]11: Gain of 18.
[[br]]00: Gain of 12. [[br]]01: Gain of 14. [[br]]10: Gain of 16. [[br]]11: Gain of 18.
Number of samplings to average: [[br]]000 -> no average. [[br]]001 -> 2 samples average. [[br]]010 -> 4 samples average. [[br]]011 -> 8 samples average. [[br]]100 -> 16 samples average.
00 Software enabled, one-shot. [[br]]01 Software enabled, continuous. [[br]]10 Hardware synchronized, one-shot. [[br]]11 Hardware synchronized, continuous.
This register will control the number of ADC clock cycles to sample (hold SoC high). [[br]]Any value programmed here will be added to the minimum requirement of 1 clock cycle.
Program the number of ADC clock cycles to wait after applying the step configuration registers and before sending the start of ADC conversion.

If the Swipe Data Compare feature is enabled (refer to bit 11) then: 00 Trigger using swipe threshold reg1. [[br]]01 Trigger using swipe threshold reg 2. [[br]]10 Trigger using swipe threshold reg 3. [[br]]11 Trigger using swipe threshold reg 4.
[[br]]00: Gain of 12. [[br]]01: Gain of 14. [[br]]10: Gain of 16. [[br]]11: Gain of 18.
[[br]]0 - disable out of range check. [[br]]1 - Compare adc data with range check register.
Sampled data will be stored in FIFO: [[br]]0 -> FIFO 0. [[br]]1 -> FIFO 1.
Differential Control Pin. [[br]]0 -> Single Ended. [[br]]1 -> Differential Pair Enable.

This register will control the number of ADC clock cycles to sample (hold SoC high). [[br]]Any value programmed here will be added to the minimum requirement of 1 clock cycle.
Program the number of ADC clock cycles to wait after applying the step configuration registers and before sending the start of ADC conversion.

If the Swipe Data Compare feature is enabled (refer to bit 11) then: 00 Trigger using swipe threshold reg1. [[br]]01 Trigger using swipe threshold reg 2. [[br]]10 Trigger using swipe threshold reg 3. [[br]]11 Trigger using swipe threshold reg 4.
[[br]]00: Gain of 12. [[br]]01: Gain of 14. [[br]]10: Gain of 16. [[br]]11: Gain of 18.
0 disable out of range check. [[br]]1 - Compare adc data with range check register.
Sampled data will be stored in FIFO: [[br]]0 -> FIFO 0. [[br]]1 -> FIFO 1.
Differential Control Pin. [[br]]0 -> Single Ended. [[br]]1 -> Differential Pair Enable.
SEL_RFM pins software configuration. [[br]]00 - VSSA. [[br]]01 - VSSA. [[br]]10 - VSSA. [[br]]11 ADCREFM. [[br]]
SEL_INP pins software configuration. [[br]]0000 -> Channel 1. [[br]]0111 -> Channel 8. [[br]]1xxx -> ADCREFM. [[br]]
SEL_INM pins for neg differential. [[br]]0000 -> Channel 1. [[br]]0111 -> Channel 8. [[br]]1xxx -> ADCREFM.
SEL_RFP pins software configuration. [[br]]000 - VDDA. [[br]]001 - VDDA. [[br]]010 - VDDA. [[br]]011 - ADCREFP. [[br]]1xx - Reserved. [[br]]

Set this bit to 1 to enable the swipe data comparing feature: [[br]]0: Feature is off (data is always saved). [[br]]1: Trigger feature is on[[br]] if adc data < swipe data threshold map pointer value then discard data[[br]] otherwise data is saved (and all future steps are saved) until mag_adc enable (bit 0) is turned off.
[[br]]00: Gain of 12. [[br]]01: Gain of 14. [[br]]10: Gain of 16. [[br]]11: Gain of 18.
[[br]]00: Gain of 12. [[br]]01: Gain of 14. [[br]]10: Gain of 16. [[br]]11: Gain of 18.
[[br]]00: Gain of 12. [[br]]01: Gain of 14. [[br]]10: Gain of 16. [[br]]11: Gain of 18.
Number of samplings to average: [[br]]000 -> no average. [[br]]001 -> 2 samples average. [[br]]010 -> 4 samples average. [[br]]011 -> 8 samples average. [[br]]100 -> 16 samples average.
00 Software enabled, one-shot. [[br]]01 Software enabled, continuous. [[br]]10 Hardware synchronized, one-shot. [[br]]11 Hardware synchronized, continuous.

This register will control the number of ADC clock cycles to sample (hold SoC high). [[br]]Any value programmed here will be added to the minimum requirement of 1 clock cycle.
Program the number of ADC clock cycles to wait after applying the step configuration registers and before sending the start of ADC conversion.
Number of words currently in the FIFO0.
Program the desired FIFO0 data sample level to reach before generating interrupt to CPU (program to value minus 1).
Number of words in FIFO0 before generating a DMA request (program to value minus 1).
Number of words currently in the FIFO1.
Program the desired FIFO1 data sample level to reach before generating interrupt to CPU (program to value minus 1).
Number of words in FIFO1 before generating a DMA request (program to value minus 1).
Optional ID tag of channel that captured the data. [[br]]If tag option is disabled, these bits will be 0.
12 bit sampled ADC converted data value stored in FIFO0.
Optional ID tag of channel that captured the data. [[br]]If tag option is disabled, these bits will be 0.
12 bit sampled ADC converted data value stored in FIFO1.
